page.title: 08RELIGION-LITTLE EASTON
page.content: Little Easton church was built 885 years ago by the Normans.There are 3 bells which were made in the 1700's now only 2 are rung for weddings and special occassions.The 16th century stained glass windows were originally in the chapel at Easton Lodge,after it was burned down,they were installed in the Maynard Chapel.In 1930 wall paintings of a medieval passion story were uncovered.On the opposite wall is a roll of rectors dated from 1336. There is a brass of Robert Fyn who was rector from 1395.Jack Filby has been the rector for 10 years,he looks after 5 parishes.There are 4 services each Sunday which alternate for each church the family service is at 11am.Through the year functions are arranged to raise money for church repairs,like flower festivals,fetes and concerts they bring the parishoners together.
